devdoc.author: Arbor Finance
devdoc.details: This uses a cloneFactory to save on gas costs during deployment. See OpenZeppelin's "Clones" proxy.

createBond(string,string,uint256,address.details: This uses a clone to save on deployment costs which adds a slight overhead when users interact with the bonds, but also saves on gas during every deployment. Emits `BondCreated` event.

params.bonds: The amount of Bonds given to the owner during the one-time mint during the `Bond`'s `initialize`.
params.collateralToken: The ERC20 token address the Bond is backed by.
params.collateralTokenAmount: The amount of collateral tokens per bond.
params.convertibleTokenAmount: The amount of convertible tokens per bond.
params.maturity: The timestamp at which the Bond will mature.
params.name: Passed into the ERC20 token to define the name.
params.paymentToken: The ERC20 token address the Bond is redeemable for.
params.symbol: Passed into the ERC20 token to define the symbol.

returns.clone: The address of the newly created Bond.

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role.

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `account`.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role.

setIsIssuerAllowListEnabled(bool).details: Must be called by the current owner.

params._isIssuerAllowListEnabled: If the issuer allow list should be enabled or not.

setIsTokenAllowListEnabled(bool).details: Must be called by the current owner.

params._isTokenAllowListEnabled: If the token allow list should be enabled or not.

isBond.details: This mapping is used to check if a bond was issued by this contract on-chain. For example, if we want to make a new contract that accepts any issued Bonds and exchanges them for new Bonds, the exchange contract would need a way to know that the Bonds are owned by this contract.

isIssuerAllowListEnabled.return: isEnabled Whether or not the `ISSUER_ROLE` will be checked when creating new bonds.

returns._0: isEnabled Whether or not the `ISSUER_ROLE` will be checked when creating new bonds.

isTokenAllowListEnabled.return: isEnabled Whether or not the collateralToken and paymentToken are checked for the `ALLOWED_TOKEN` role when creating new bonds.

returns._0: isEnabled Whether or not the collateralToken and paymentToken are checked for the `ALLOWED_TOKEN` role when creating new bonds.

tokenImplementation.details: This is needed since we are using a clone proxy.

devdoc.title: Bond Factory

CollateralTokenAmountLessThanConvertible.notice: There must be more collateralTokens than convertibleTokens.

InvalidDeposit().notice: Fails if the collateralToken takes a fee.

TokensMustBeDifferent().notice: The paymentToken and collateralToken must be different.

TooManyDecimals().notice: Decimals with more than 18 digits are not supported.

ZeroBondsToMint().notice: Bonds must be minted during initialization.

BondCreated(address,string,string,addres.notice: Emitted when a new bond is created.

IssuerAllowListEnabled(bool).notice: Emitted when the restriction of bond creation to allow-listed accounts is toggled on or off.

TokenAllowListEnabled(bool).notice: Emitted when the restriction of collateralToken and paymentToken to allow-listed tokens is toggled on or off.

ALLOWED_TOKEN().notice: The role given to allowed tokens.

ISSUER_ROLE().notice: The role required to issue bonds.

createBond(string,string,uint256,address.notice: Creates a new Bond. The calculated ratios are rounded down.

isBond(address).notice: Returns whether or not the given address key is a bond created by this Bond factory.

isIssuerAllowListEnabled().notice: If enabled, issuance is restricted to those with ISSUER_ROLE.

isTokenAllowListEnabled().notice: If enabled, tokens used as paymentToken and collateralToken are restricted to those with the ALLOWED_TOKEN role.

setIsIssuerAllowListEnabled(bool).notice: Sets the state of bond restriction to allow-listed accounts.

setIsTokenAllowListEnabled(bool).notice: Sets the state of token restriction to the list of allowed tokens.

tokenImplementation().notice: Address where the bond implementation contract is stored.

userdoc.notice: This factory contract issues new bond contracts.
